title: Cell Growth Conditions and ATP Production

content.question: Read each question carefully. Write your response in the space provided for each part of each question. Answers must be written out in paragraph form. Outlines, bulleted lists, or diagrams alone are not acceptable and will not be scored.Researchers studied the relationship between glucose concentration, oxygen level, and <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> production in one type of mammalian cell. Cells were isolated and cultured in growth medium containing either <math alttext="1.5 millimolar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.5</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>mM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> glucose or <math alttext="25 millimolar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>25 mM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> glucose and at oxygen levels that varied from <math alttext="0%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="21%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>21</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. The researchers determined the concentration of <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> per cell under the different conditions. The <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> concentrations are shown as relative to the maximum <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> concentration obtained when cells were cultured in the presence of <math alttext="25 millimolar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>25 mM</mtext></mrow></math> glucose and <math alttext="21%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>21</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> oxygen, standard culture conditions. The data are shown in Table 1.Table 1. Relative concentration of <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> per cell under different growth conditionsConcentration of overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> (a) Describe the role of oxygen in cellular respiration.
(b) Using the template, construct an appropriately labeled graph to represent the data in Table 1.

(c) Describe the relationship between the concentration of glucose in the culture medium and the <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> concentration in the cells.

(d) In a further experiment, the researchers add a compound to the cell growth medium that both binds and releases protons <math alttext="H with a positive 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msup><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and also passes through lipid membranes. Predict the effect of this added compound on <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> production by the cells. Justify your prediction.
